citations.desc: Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC).
citations.narrative:
On Dec 20, 2022, facility veterinarians discovered 4 ferrets had been anesthetized with a drug combination that was not
described in the IACUC approved protocol for the study under which the procedure occurred. The ferrets fully recovered
from anesthesia without incident. The personnel administering the anesthesia were following instructions given to them by
the principal investigator (PI) for the study. The PI had changed the drugs used to anesthetize ferrets in the study without
prior IACUC review and approval.
The IACUC, in its role to oversee the welfare of the animals by assessing the facility’s animal program and procedures,
must review and approve, require modifications in (to secure approval), or withhold approval of proposed significant
changes regarding the care and use of animals in ongoing activities. An amendment to change the anesthesia drugs for
the ferrets in the study was submitted January 5, 2023 and approved by the IACUC on January 11, 2023.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the Attending Veterinarian.
